Sightseeing in Cimiez Area of Nice, 27 April 2003

---WANT A LARGER PICTURE? JUST CLICK ON IT!---
---In the north of Nice is the location of Roman ruins-- called the Cimiez area. Cemenelum was founded by Augustus in 14BC and was the capital from 1st to 4th century of Alpes Maritimae providence.---
---We first visited the Archaelogy Museum. It was wonderful and should NOT be missed! It housed artifacts from the Bronze and Iron Age (1100 BC) to the Dark Ages.---

---Model of La Formigue C shipwreck from around 80 BC found in Golfe-Juan near Antibes.
---The famous bronze Mask of Silenus found on the shipwreck. It was hard to photograph with the reflections---
---Another try---

---A selection of different types of amphorae found on the shipwreck.---
---1st century AD statue of Antonia Minor, daughter of Mark Anthony and mother of Emperor Cladius.---
---Another well-preserved statue. Note how all have their heads cut off.---
